soil.Comment: Soil naming structure: \soils\Australia\South Australia\Region\Classification (Location APSoil No). Root depth: Wheat (Correll) 60cm

soil.name: Clay loam over clay on rock (Navan East No280)
soil.DataSource: Characterisation 2007 by University of Adelaide, CSIRO Sustainable Ecosystems and AgriLink Agricultural Consultants as part of GRDC project Training growers to manage soil water
soil.Comment: Soil naming structure: \soils\Australia\South Australia\Region\Classification (Location APSoil No). CLL wheat measured, other crops estimated; DM profile description: 0-10cm Clay loam 5YR 3/3; 10-30cm Medium clay 2.5YR 3/2; 30-60cm Light clay 5YR 3/4; 60-90cm Light-medium clay 10YR 5/3; 90-150cm Light-medium clay 2.5Y 5/2. Root depth: Wheat (Correll) 60cm

soil.name: Red light sandy clay loam (MAC Loam No354)
soil.DataSource: Data collected by J Hancock (SARDI), APSOIL by A Whitbread (CSIRO). Financially supported by the EPFSPII (SARDI/GRDC) and Project DRT-35C “Improving the Use of Plant Available Water in Low Rainfall Cropping & Pasture Systems” (SA Drought Response Team).
soil.Comment: LL15 and DUL (at 10 kpa) laboratory measured. Upper and lower limits adjusted for presence of rocks. EC is ECe dS/m. ESP is adjusted for salt content. Organic C is Walkely Black x 1.3. Rock % is by volume. Airdry is calculated as 50% of LL15 for top layer

soil.name: Red sandy clay loam (MAC Heavy No353)
soil.DataSource: Data collected by J Hancock (SARDI), APSOIL by A Whitbread (CSIRO). Financially supported by the EPFSPII (SARDI/GRDC) and Project DRT-35C “Improving the Use of Plant Available Water in Low Rainfall Cropping & Pasture Systems” (SA Drought Response Team).
soil.Comment: LL15 and DUL (at 10 kpa) laboratory measured. Upper and lower limits adjusted for presence of rocks. EC is ECe dS/m. ESP is adjusted for salt content. Organic C is Walkely Black x 1.3. Rock % is by volume. Airdry is calculated as 50% of LL15 for top layer
